intro: Xylobium brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked xylobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
